oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Acuff Chapel, David Lipscomb University, Nashville, Tennessee, 1981 April
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An exterior view of Acuff Chapel on the campus of David Lipscomb University in Nashville, Tennessee, circa April 1981. Acuff Chapel stands as a tribute to the generosity and devotion of Mr. and Mrs. J. E. Acuff. The building was constructed circa 1958 and dedicated in 1959. The original name of the institution was the Nashville Bible School, which was changed to David Lipscomb College, then to David Lipscomb University. In 2005, the institution was renamed simply Lipscomb University. The campus grounds consist predominantly of the former estate of David Lipscomb, who donated it to the school. It is affiliated with the Churches of Christ. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Acuff family
